channel.title: Intel AMX accelerated Multicloud GitOps with Openshift AI on Validated Patterns
channel.description: Recent content in Intel AMX accelerated Multicloud GitOps with Openshift AI on Validated Patterns

item.title: Getting started
item.description: Deploying the Intel AMX accelerated Multicloud GitOps pattern with Openshift AI Prerequisites An OpenShift cluster To create an OpenShift cluster, go to the Red Hat Hybrid Cloud console and select Services -> Containers -> Create cluster.

item.title: Hello-world Demo
item.description: Introduction The multicloud gitops pattern is designed to be an entrypoint into the Validated Patterns framework. Demo, accesible within the pattern, contains two applications config-demo and hello-world to show the basic configuration and execution examples.

item.title: Intel AMX Demo
item.description: Introduction The Intel AMX accelerated Multicloud GitOps pattern with Openshift AI provides developers and data scientists with RedÂ Hat OpenShift AI product that is fully configured and ready to go.

item.title: Managed cluster sites
item.description: Attach a managed cluster (edge) to the management hub Understanding Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management requirements By default, Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management (RHACM) manages the clusterGroup applications that are deployed on all clusters.

item.title: Cluster sizing
item.description: About OpenShift cluster sizing for the Intel AMX accelerated Multicloud GitOps pattern The minimum requirements for an OpenShift Container Platform cluster depend on your installation platform, for example:

item.title: Imperative actions
item.description: Using kubernetes cronjobs to apply imperative actions There is currently no way within Argo CD to apply an imperative action against a cluster.

item.title: Ideas for customization
item.description: Ideas for customization About customizing the pattern Multicloud GitOps pattern One of the major goals of the Validated Patterns development process is to create modular, customizable demos.
